article: When Hannah, a ten-year-old fifth grader, came home from school, she was in a panic. She told her parents that all students were required to take up a sport--- no exceptions. Hannah thought of herself as totally uncoordinated ---she _ couldn't master a two-wheeler. "Now everyone will see what a _ I am," she cried. At last, Hannah chose soccer. _ the first soccer meeting was held one week later, she was _ . She got a complete surprise when the coach spoke. He told the schoolgirls, "All I _ is that you try your best; _ you can achieve a victory is unimportant. I want you to keep _ as a member of this team, to develop your skills." At the _ practice on Monday, Hannah was standing on the field not _ what she was supposed to be doing, when the coach yelled, "Hannah--- I can see that you are _ what you should do. Good attitude!" Hannah was _ . Two days later, she ran for a ball, tried to kick it, and _ it entirely. The coach said, "Good girl, I like your initiative . Keep it up." That Friday, Hannah decided to go for a ball, ran hard, gave it a kick, _ , and eventually fell heavily to the ground . She was extremely _ . The coach shouted, "See that, girls?" That's the kind of effort we are looking for!" Hannah was laughing as two of her teammates helped her _ . By the end of the season, Hannah was not a _ soccer player, her team didn't win either. However, Hannah gained a sense of pride. She learned that she could _ new things without fear of making a fool of herself, and be valued for her _ . And that's what a(n) inspirational teacher can do.
